intro: Lophodium recurvum, commonly known as the spiral fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of pinnae, which gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a leathery texture. Lophodium recurvum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and can thrive in both indoor and outdoor settings.
